intro: Camissonia claviformis, commonly known as the keyleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, key-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as slopes and meadows. Camissonia claviformis is an herbaceous perennial that is often found in arid and semi-arid regions.
